column4: Hey I have an issue with mysql =(  ERROR 2002 (HY000): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)
i had this error too... not sure how i solved it... try checking the .conf file
there is no conf >D? wtf
root@mail ~ # locate my.conf root@mail ~ # locate my.cnf
both nothing
if i vi it vi wants to create a new file
this file also dont exist - what the heck is going on oO
my.cnf is probably playing hide&seek :P
i think locate is fine and if locate didnt find anything ... the file just dont exist -.-
i would say you try to reinstall the mysql-server package
apt-get install -reinstall mysql-server?
does it delete my databases oO???
Just /etc/mysql/conf.d/mysqld_safe_syslog.cnf  and /usr/share/doc/mysql-server-5.1/examples/my-small.cnf
try reading /etc/mysql/conf.d/mysqld_safe_syslog.cnf,   /usr/share/doc/mysql-server-5.1/examples/my-small.cnf is just a documentation
content of the file> [mysqld_safe] syslog
im honestly out of ideas,
thanks
mh maybe I need to create the my.conf file?
x-actly :P
no i created both files - mysql still doesnt work
mysqld_safe works =)
no ... site is running - in safe mode and with mysqld
check , check, cheeeeeeeck the .cnf
